intro: Sisymbrium juniperorum, commonly known as the juniper mustard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant is often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems. Sisymbrium juniperorum is also known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it an important component of its native habitat.
